page.title: 07THE CHURCHES IN COOKLEY
page.content: There are two churches and one chapel in the area. The one church really belongs to the village of {CHURCHILL}and so is not considered here. The most substantial building is the Church of England ,St. Peters, which now shares its vicar with the parish of {Wolverley}. The Methodist Chapel is a much smaller building but seems to have a lively congregation despite having a circuit preacher. The two religious centres unfortunately do not seem to involve many of the villagers but are supported by the stalwart few.
